com.samskivert.util

Class Calendars.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samskivert.util.Calendars.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    Calendars

    public static class Calendars.Builder
extends Object
    Provides fluent methods for operating on a Calendar.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Calendars.Builder add(int field, int amount)
      See Calendar.add(int, int).
      Calendars.Builder addDays(int days)
      Adds the specified value to the Calendar.DATE field.
      Calendars.Builder addHours(int hours)
      Adds the specified value to the Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY field.
      Calendars.Builder addMinutes(int minutes)
      Adds the specified value to the Calendar.MINUTE field.
      Calendars.Builder addMonths(int months)
      Adds the specified value to the Calendar.MONTH field.
      Calendars.Builder addYears(int years)
      Adds the specified value to the Calendar.YEAR field.
      Calendar asCalendar()
      Returns the wrapped Calendar instance.
      Calendars.Builder at(int year, int month, int day)
      Sets the time to zero milliseconds after midnight on the specified year, month and day.
      int get(int field)
      See Calendar.get(int).
      Calendars.Builder in(TimeZone zone)
      See Calendar.setTimeZone(TimeZone).
      Calendars.Builder roll(int field, boolean up)
      See Calendar.roll(int, boolean).
      Calendars.Builder set(int field, int value)
      See Calendar.set(int,int).
      Calendars.Builder setTime(Date date)
      See Calendar.setTime(Date).
      Calendars.Builder setTime(long millis)
      See Calendar.setTimeInMillis(long).
      Date toDate()
      Returns a Date configured with our calendar's current time.
      Date toSQLDate()
      Returns a Date configured with our calendar's current time.
      long toTime()
      Returns the milliseconds since the epoch for our calendar's current time.
      Timestamp toTimestamp()
      Returns a Timestamp configured with our calendar's current time.
      Calendars.Builder zeroTime()
      Zeros out the time fields of this calendar, preserving only the date.

    • Method Detail

      • addYears

        public Calendars.Builder addYears(int years)
        Adds the specified value to the Calendar.YEAR field. Use negative values to subtract.

      • addMonths

        public Calendars.Builder addMonths(int months)
        Adds the specified value to the Calendar.MONTH field. Use negative values to subtract.

      • addDays

        public Calendars.Builder addDays(int days)
        Adds the specified value to the Calendar.DATE field. Use negative values to subtract.

      • addHours

        public Calendars.Builder addHours(int hours)
        Adds the specified value to the Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY field. Use negative values to subtract.

      • addMinutes

        public Calendars.Builder addMinutes(int minutes)
        Adds the specified value to the Calendar.MINUTE field. Use negative values to subtract.

      • add

        public Calendars.Builder add(int field,
                             int amount)
        See Calendar.add(int, int).

      • roll

        public Calendars.Builder roll(int field,
                              boolean up)
        See Calendar.roll(int, boolean).

      • set

        public Calendars.Builder set(int field,
                             int value)
        See Calendar.set(int,int).

      • setTime

        public Calendars.Builder setTime(Date date)
        See Calendar.setTime(Date).

      • setTime

        public Calendars.Builder setTime(long millis)
        See Calendar.setTimeInMillis(long).

      • at

        public Calendars.Builder at(int year,
                            int month,
                            int day)
        Sets the time to zero milliseconds after midnight on the specified year, month and day. This mirrors Calendars.at(long) for when you need e.g. a custom timezone: 
        Calendars.in(zone).at(2009, Calendar.JANUARY, 1)

      • in

        public Calendars.Builder in(TimeZone zone)
        See Calendar.setTimeZone(TimeZone).

      • zeroTime

        public Calendars.Builder zeroTime()
        Zeros out the time fields of this calendar, preserving only the date.

      • toTime

        public long toTime()
        Returns the milliseconds since the epoch for our calendar's current time.

      • toDate

        public Date toDate()
        Returns a Date configured with our calendar's current time.

      • toSQLDate

        public Date toSQLDate()
        Returns a Date configured with our calendar's current time.

      • toTimestamp

        public Timestamp toTimestamp()
        Returns a Timestamp configured with our calendar's current time.

      • get

        public int get(int field)
        See Calendar.get(int).

      • asCalendar

        public Calendar asCalendar()
        Returns the wrapped Calendar instance. Note: modifications to the returned calendar will also affect this instance.
